Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Research on the European Emission Trading System and its reform: (1) In June 2013, I responded to a consultation by the European Commission on ‘Options for structural measures to improve the European Union Emissions Trading System (EU ETS)’. (2) I presented my proposal to the European Commission in November 2013. (3) I have been working with the UK Government’s Department of Energy and Climate Change (DECC) to test the thresholds under a range of assumptions. DECC used the results of our research to inform their negotiations about the EU ETS MSR. (4) I have also presented my work at workshops hosted by the European Parliament Committee on the Environment, Public Health and Food Safety, and the Centre for European Policy Studies. I have provided oral evidence to the House of Commons Select committee on Energy and Climate Change Committee during its inquiry on linking emissions trading systems. (5) I have been advising governments (China, South Korea, Germany, France, Singapore) regarding the pros and cons of the MSR and I have participated in international committees (CEPS task force on MSR, DIW task force on MSR, PMR lead by World Bank Group) with the objective to assess the impact of the MSR and formulate recommendations to governments and policy makers.

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Dahrendorf Grant Summary: A 1-year grant funded by the Stiftung Mercator for organizing and hosting the second Dahrendorf Symposium entitled ‘Changing the European Debate: focus on climate change’, together with Stiftung Mercator and the Hertie School of Governance Berlin. Total budget: €200,000

Centre for Climate Change Economics and Policy (Phase II) Summary: A 5-year grant funded by the ESRC to continue research on the evolution and design of carbon markets around the world. Role: I contributed to the development of the research idea, designed the original pre-bidding work program and negotiated funding for a 3-year PhD student. Total project budget: £200,000 Time: 2013-2018

FP7 ENTR’ACTE Summary: A 3-year Seventh Research Framework Programme grant funded by the European Commission to assess the EU's climate portfolio paying special attention to the European Union Emissions Trading System (EU ETS) and its interaction with additional policy instruments. Total budget: €3 million

NORAD "Options Market and Risk-Reduction Tools for REDD+" Summary: A 3-year grant funded by Norad for the development of a suite of risk-management tools for policy makers working on avoided deforestation issues. Total budget: 12 million Norwegian kroner (£1.2 million)

Amundi and the Europlace Institute of Finance "Managing Investment Portfolios in a Changing Climate" Summary: A 1-year grant funded by Amundi for co-steering the organization of the Call for Research Project `Aligning Investment Portfolios Management with a Low Carbon Economy' and conduct research on the implications of climate change related risks on financial markets. Total budget: €20,000

NORAD “Delivering Incentives to End Deforestation: Global Ambition, Private/Public Finance, and Zero-Deforestation Supply Chains” Summary: A 5-year grant funded by Norad for the research and modeling that supports the development of policy proposals for REDD+ markets, designs for private/public partnerships, and innovative financing and risk-reduction approaches for REDD+. Total budget: 11 million Norwegian kroner (£1.1 million)
